awd_titl_txt: McMurdo Sound MetSat Station:  Upgrade, Maintenance, and    ARC
awd_abstract_narration: During the last year Scripps Institution of Oceanography has been               involved with SeaSpace, Inc. to install and maintain a weather                  satellite image receive and display system in Antarctica and at                 the Scripps campus.  The system was successfully installed and is               fully operational.  The system serves two purposes, 1) provides                 the only real.time imagery of the Antarctic continent for flight                forecasting and 2) records the imagery along with other embedded                atmospheric data sets for play back and analysis by the science                 community.  This proposal seeks to upgrade the computer systems                 in McMurdo to reduce processing time, set up a science work                     station in Antarctica and to continue operations and maintenance                of the systems including data archive and display for                           investigators interested in these data sets.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
